intro: Codonoboea personatiflora, commonly known as the broad-leaved codonopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Native to tropical regions of Africa, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. It produces a milky sap that is often used in traditional medicine. The plant's unique floral structure and medicinal properties make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
